edu.uci.calismall

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uci.calismall.Utils

  • public final class Utils
extends Object
    Contains static methods that are used all over the code base.
    Author:
    Michele Bonazza

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Utils() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String actionToString(int action)
      Returns a string that represents the symbolic name of the specified action such as "ACTION_DOWN", "ACTION_POINTER_DOWN(3)" or an equivalent numeric constant such as "35" if unknown.
      static void debug(String message)
      Logs the argument message as a debug string.
      static <T> T getLast(List<T> list)
      Returns the last element in the argument list.
      static <T> T getLast(T[] array)
      Returns the last element in the argument array.
      static String pointToString(Point point)
      Returns what Point.toString() should have returned (without the initial "Point" that the toString() default implementation returns).
      static String pointToString(PointF point)
      Returns what PointF.toString() should have returned, but Android developers were too lazy to implement.

    • Method Detail

      • debug

        public static void debug(String message)
        Logs the argument message as a debug string.

        This method splits the message into several in case the message is larger than the largest String that LogCat can handle for a single print call.

        Parameters:
        message - the message to be logged

      • getLast

        public static <T> T getLast(T[] array)
        Returns the last element in the argument array.

        The last element is the one at index array.length - 1, or null if array is empty or null.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects stored into the array
        Parameters:
        array - the array from which to retrieve the last element
        Returns:
        the last element in the array or null if array is empty or null

      • getLast

        public static <T> T getLast(List<T> list)
        Returns the last element in the argument list.

        The last element is the one at index list.size() - 1, or null if list is empty or null.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects stored into the list
        Parameters:
        list - the list from which to retrieve the last element
        Returns:
        the last element in the list or null if list is empty or null

      • pointToString

        public static String pointToString(PointF point)
        Returns what PointF.toString() should have returned, but Android developers were too lazy to implement.
        Parameters:
        point - the point of which a String representation must be returned
        Returns:
        a String containing the point's coordinates enclosed within parentheses

      • pointToString

        public static String pointToString(Point point)
        Returns what Point.toString() should have returned (without the initial "Point" that the toString() default implementation returns).
        Parameters:
        point - the point of which a String representation must be returned
        Returns:
        a String containing the point's coordinates enclosed within parentheses

      • actionToString

        public static String actionToString(int action)
        Returns a string that represents the symbolic name of the specified action such as "ACTION_DOWN", "ACTION_POINTER_DOWN(3)" or an equivalent numeric constant such as "35" if unknown. By Google.
        Parameters:
        action - The action.
        Returns:
        The symbolic name of the specified action.
